adventure_overview: Swimming is a great way to stay healthy.  In this Adventure you will ​ ​ have a chance to get wet while you learn the rules to swimming safely. To earn this Adventure, you may enroll in and complete a swimming instruction program offered by an accredited instructor OR ​ ​ pass ​ ​Scouting America swimmer test OR complete the requirements below. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved.

requirements.text: Learn about the swimming safety rules that you need to follow.

activities.name: Rules Relay
activities.description: Cub Scouts will learn swimming rules through a relay race game.

requirements.text: Demonstrate how to enter the swimming area properly.

activities.name: Swim Area Safety
activities.description: Before going swimming Cub Scouts learn how to properly enter the swimming area.

requirements.text: Using the buddy system and staying within your ability group, go swimming with your den or family for 30 minutes.

activities.name: Go Swimming
activities.description: Take your den and go swimming.

requirements.text: Attempt at least one swimming stroke: front crawl, restful backstroke, or breaststroke.

activities.name: Swimming Form
activities.description: Cub Scouts will  attempt  to swim using a specific swimming stroke. Requirements 1, 2, and 3 must be completed first.

requirements.text: Jump feet first into water that is chest high or deeper.

activities.name: Jump On In
activities.description: Cub Scouts jump into a pool in chest deep water. Requirements 1, 2, and 3 must be completed first.

requirements.text: Demonstrate how to exit the swimming area properly.

activities.name: Getting Out of the Pool
activities.description: Cub Scouts  demonstrate  how to properly exit the pool.
